definitions.definition: a small round piece of metal, plastic, etc. that is sewn onto a piece of clothing and used for fastening two parts together

examples.text: to do up/undo your buttons
to button/unbutton your buttons
to sew on a button
shirt buttons
a row of gilt buttons
One of the buttons on his jacket was missing.
My coat has lost a button.
The top button of his shirt was undone.
There was a button missing from his shirt.
His fingers fumbled to do up/​button the small buttons on his shirt.
I need to sew this button back on.

definitions.definition: a small part of a machine that you press to make it work

examples.text: the start/stop/pause button
Adam **pressed a button** and waited for the lift.
Choose ‘printer’ from the menu and click with the right mouse button.
She **pushed a button** on the control panel.
I **hit** the play **button** on the remote.
The windows slide down **at the touch of a button**.
With a push of a button, I can print out everything I need.
She hit the alarm button as fast as she could.
The remote control allows you to change channel at the touch of a button.

phrases: at the touch of a button

definitions.definition: a small area on a computer screen that you click on to make it do something

examples.text: **Click on** the back **button** to go back to the previous screen.
Click the ‘Finish’ button in the top right-hand corner of the screen.
I **hit** the ‘Reply’ **button** in the mail toolbar.

phrases: at the touch of a button

definitions.definition: a badge, especially one with a message printed on it

examples.text: He wore a button saying ‘Life begins at 40!’
She wore a ‘Vote Yes’ lapel button.
The candidates all distributed campaign buttons and bumper stickers.
They all wore buttons saying ‘Stop the war’.
He carries around an old backpack with peace buttons on it.

definitions.definition: at exactly the right time or at the exact time mentioned

examples.text: We arrived at 4 o'clock on the button.
You're on the button there!

definitions.definition: to do exactly the right things to please somebody

examples.text: a new satirical comedy show that pushes all the right buttons

definitions.definition: to make somebody react in either a positive or a negative way

examples.text: I've known him for years, but I still don't know what pushes his buttons.

wordOrigin: Middle English: from Old French bouton, of Germanic origin and related to the verb butt.
